Class FileBasedTransactionSampler

java.lang.Object
ca.yorku.cmg.cnsim.engine.sampling.interfaces.AbstractTransactionSampler
ca.yorku.cmg.cnsim.engine.sampling.filesamplers.FileBasedTransactionSampler
All Implemented Interfaces:
ISowable
public class FileBasedTransactionSampler extends AbstractTransactionSampler
Transaction sampler that reads transaction information from a CSV file.

The file is expected to contain transactions with the following columns:

  1. Transaction ID (ignored)
  2. Transaction size (long)
  3. Transaction fee (float)
  4. Transaction arrival time (long, milliseconds)
Optionally, the first line can be a header, which will be skipped.

If the file does not contain enough transactions as specified in the configuration property workload.numTransactions, an optional AbstractTransactionSampler can be used to supply additional transaction intervals, sizes, and fees.

Author:
Sotirios Liaskos

    • FileBasedTransactionSampler

      public FileBasedTransactionSampler(String transactionsFilePath)
      Creates a FileBasedTransactionSampler that reads transactions from a file.
      Parameters:
      transactionsFilePath - Path to the CSV file containing transaction data

    • FileBasedTransactionSampler

      public FileBasedTransactionSampler(String transactionsFilePath, AbstractTransactionSampler randomSampler)
      Creates a FileBasedTransactionSampler with an alternative sampler.

      The alternative sampler is used when the file does not contain enough transactions as specified in configuration.

      Parameters:
      transactionsFilePath - Path to the CSV file containing transaction data
      randomSampler - Alternative AbstractTransactionSampler for missing transactions

    • getConflict

      public int getConflict(int id, int N, double alpha, double likelihood)
      Description copied from class: AbstractTransactionSampler
      Pick a random match for a given ID with distance bias controlled by alpha.
      Specified by:
      getConflict in class AbstractTransactionSampler
      Parameters:
      id - Target ID (1 .. N)
      N - Total number of IDs (ignored if conflict comes predefined)
      alpha - Closeness parameter [0,1]: 0 -> almost always near 'id' 1 -> can pick anywhere in range (near edges possible) (ignored if conflict comes predefined)
      likelihood - The likelihood that the transaction has a conflict.
      Returns:
      Chosen matching ID
